Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 10:38AM annamari wrote: Hi!  My immune system was compromised while on chemo. Otherwise I've had no problems. I did get my flu, H1n1, pneumonia vacinations and have not even had as much as a cold since well before I was diagnoised in Dec 08.  I do believe some people have more problems with it than I've had.  Having had pneumonia now I think that you should becareful not to expose yourself to anything too soon.  Just to be on the safe side.  Wishing you all the best.and blessings.
Posts.Title: is it true our immune system is lower then before? PraiseTheLord PraiseTheLord

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2011 03:21AM annamari wrote: Could you ossibly be allergic to the tape that was use? Also when you are healing you sometimes get itchy.  I have issues with tape and use it sparingly and I am very itchy after recon surgery as well as the other surgery I have had.  When it getsreal bad I use a bit of Lidocan so I can't feel it.
Posts.Title: itchy and heavy post biopsy. teesa2you teesa2you
is it true our immune system is lower then before? PraiseTheLord PraiseTheLord

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2010 09:36AM annamari wrote: I do have a Breast form  but there are other options.  One is a product called "Been-a-boob"  they are about $65.00 in Canada.  If you are a Knitter there is instructions to something called Tit Bit and I found it through a friend It is available at WWWcanadianliving.com/october.  I am going to try to make one for myself.  the Breastforms here cost about $450.00+.  I even had problems finding a cotton mastectomy bra.  I get itchy with nylon and polyester.  Good luck finding something reasonably priced
Posts.Title: Why do I "need" $$$ silicone breastforms? lovemygarden lovemygarden

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2010 04:12PM annamari wrote: I had lot of nail involvement when I was on Chemo.  TCH.  My toenails got pusy and I lost them soaked my feet in apple cider vinegar and hot water several times a day. Also lost fingernails.  I am on a drug study that is similar to Herceptin and I am having problems with my big toenails again  I am soaking with epsom salt and it seems to be helping a bit.  It will get better.or I'll have to have the nails removed. They told me Bursol might also help.  Good luck with it.
Posts.Title: PUSS COMING FROM FINGERNAILS herekitty024 herekitty024

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2011 05:28PM annamari wrote: Hi!  It seems we are usually refered to see a surgeon first.  The surgeon sent me to see the onc because of the size of my cancer and I had. chemo and then surgery and radiation.  Being Grade 3 you will probably have chemo after surgery.  Maybe not radiation because you are opting out for a mastectomy instead of a lumpectomy.  If you are Her2 + you should recieve Herceptin.  I hope this helps you.

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2011 06:35PM annamari wrote: I got my results about 10 days after having the biopsy done and had Her2 results as well.  They will let you Know when they have them.. otherwise you can call to find out.
Posts.Title: DCIS ER-/PR- HER2unknown Flamingolover Beesie

Posts.Content: May 10, 2010 05:31PM annamari wrote: Hi !!! I am Her2 +++  11cm x 6cm lesion with at least 3+ nodes.  Did 6 rounds TCH and continued to have another 11 Herceptin.  Had surgery Mastecomy 05/15/09 followed by 30 rads started05/15/09.  I am currently in the Neratnib Trial.  I could possibly be on the real thing as I still have a fair bit of diarrhea 4 months into it.  Good luck everyone
Posts.Title: Any Stage 3, HER2+ (only), Node(s) + Girls here? Frankie_ amlg1

Posts.Content: May 26, 2010 11:16PM annamari wrote: The Neratineb trail is a year long study for Her +++ breast canncer patients who have finished 1 year Herceptin.  It is to see if this drug will help prevent reoccurance to the brain.  This drug is supposed to cross the blood brain barrier where as Herceptin does not.  I hope tis will help you.  There is a tread on here about the Trial.
Posts.Title: Any Stage 3, HER2+ (only), Node(s) + Girls here? Frankie_ amlg1

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2011 02:02AM annamari wrote: I just finished a year on Neratinib trial and diarrhea was a big issue.  I tried imodium and it did not help.  I did not use any dairy products and if I did I had problems   I followed a BRAT diet.  Daily banana Rice Applesauce and Toast. I hope that will help you girls some as well,

Posts.Title: Tykerb Tummy Trouble momto2angels makmak

Posts.Content: May 3, 2010 03:09PM annamari wrote: you are not going mad!  This uncertainty is horrible.  and we all grew up with the thought that cancer is a death sentence.  I think we all cry about the diagnosis or the potential of BC.  You need to take one day at a time. Trust God and your docs for the best diagnosis and treatment.  I am about 1.5 years since diagnosis and doing well.  You will too, and also remember that most lumps are B9.  Wednesday will give you a better idea of what you are or are not facing.  Blessings and I hope you'll have pease of mind
Posts.Title: I'm petrified but bravo to all of you! juliaflood Lisa1962
